Example 1.outcome: Online reading, video lessons and doing practice during lessons
Example 1.subject: Students will be able to create complex devices and systems using microcontrollers and microprocessors, and online simulation.

Example 1.outcome: Read book chapters and articles on websites.
Example 1.subject: Students will be able to choose intermediary devices, protocols, communication tools, cloud platforms, sensors, and actuators required for their projects.

Example 1.outcome: Find real-world problems and create IoT solutions to the existing problems using knowledge gained through lectures and lab work.
Example 1.subject: Students will be able to apply their solutions in different areas.

Example 1.outcome: Search web engines for existing solutions similar to problems found and do lab works.
Example 1.subject: Students will be to design IoT solutions to the existing problems.

Example 1.outcome: Review similar works, compare existing products and systems, experiment development boards, sensors and actuators.
Example 1.subject: Students will be able to solve real-world problems using IoT technologies.

Example 1.title: Assignments and will be submitted individually. Project will be conducted as a group work of 3-4 students. All course materials including textbook, lectures, assignments, and project requirements will be available on Moodle platform.

Example 1.objective:
The Internet of Things (IoT) is a foundation stone of the Industry 4.0 revolution. The “things” of IoT are the internet enabled devices that communicate with devices through a network. Data is measured from a physical environment by sensors and devices and transferred to the network. The network type used in the Internet of Things can be either wireless or wired connected. Types of the network are selected according to the aim of the system. IoT devices are implemented in any organization that makes it controlled remotely or automated. This process decreases human power and energy, and creates secure places. IoT systems can be found in retail energy, smart home and smart city projects, consumer applications, healthcare, education, etc.
The aim of the course is to understand basic concepts of IoT hardware, networking, and programming, and apply IoT systems and devices in different application areas. Something
